habitat_description: This species is restricted to a short section (16-17km) of the Merced River, on the main highway to Yosemite National Park near a region known as Hell Hollow at elevations 365-760 meters (Lannoo 2005; Green et al. 2013). Habitat is generally associated with limestone and individuals are found under slabs and irregularly shaped pieces of limestone. Some individuals have been found in small areas covered by mosses or in steep slopes where it appears that individuals use their tail in locomotion (Gorman 1954). “tributaries in Mariposa Co. at 255-800 m (836-2624 ft) elevation” (Zeiner et al. 1988-1990)
